title: Getting Started with Flask, React and MySQL: Build a full application
author: Dennis Kibet
content:
introduction

In the ever-evolving landscape of web development, it's essential to stay up-to-date with the latest tools and frameworks that empower us to build robust and efficient applications.

React, has gained immense popularity for its flexibility and performance. Flask, offers a simple yet powerful approach to backend development.

And SQLite, provides a seamless way to store and manage data within our applications.In this blog post, we will create a full stack web application with â€“ React, Flask, and SQLite. We'll explore the unique strengths and features of each component and learn how they complement each other to build a dynamic and responsive application.

This tutorial will provide you with the knowledge and tools to embark on your next project with confidence.Getting started with react.
To get started with React, begin by setting up a development environment with Node.js and npm installed. Then, create a new React project using a tool like Create React App, and you'll be ready to dive into building dynamic and interactive user interfaces with React's component-based architecture.npx create-react-app react-flask-app --template typescriptcd my-appnpm start
